p: Take compound 11 as an example, its fragment ions at m/z 167.0359, 152.0128, 123.0474, and 108.0251 were identified as vanillic acid hexose. The ion at m/z 167.0359 was obtained by the loss of hexose, while the ion at m/z 123.0474 was produced by continuous loss of CO 2. Meanwhile, the ion at m/z 152.0128 was obtained by the loss of CH 3 from the precursor ion at m/z 167.0359, while the ion at m/z 108.0251 was produced by continuous loss of CO 2. Based on the above fragment ions, which was obtained in the MS 2 spectrum, the structure of compound 11 was easily confirmed as vanillic acid hexose.
